conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to extend an offer at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the remainder of the matching process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is ranked 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). Although Student_B lists School_B as first choice and applied immediately, accepting now would lock our only seat and prevent us from matching with higher-priority Student_D or Student_A, who both rank School_B highly (3rd) and may apply after attempting their top choices. In a student-proposing environment, it is plausible Student_D will first apply to School_C/School_A and could be rejected due to competition, then come to School_B. Therefore, to maximize the chance of a higher-priority match within quota 1, we should reject Student_B now rather than commit early.
